In Warner Brothers Looney Tunes cartoons, what was the name of the amorous French skunk? Pepé Le Pew.
What nationality was the philosopher Soren Kierkegaard? Danish.
Which band did Mick Jones form on leaving the Clash? Big Audio Dynamite.
Who wrote the novel 'Cold Comfort Farm' in 1932? Stella Gibbons.
In which year was the Battle of the Little Big Horn? 1876.
In which English county was Charles Darwin born? Shropshire.
The steel pan (or drum) is the national instrument of which island nation, where it was invented? Trinidad and Tobago.
Which of the halogens has the lowest atomic number (9)? Fluorine.
Which Shakespeare play is set in Sicilia and Bohemia? The Winter’s Tale.
Which historic region of France, roughly corresponding to the Dordogne, gives its name to black truffles? Perigord.
For what does the C stand in the acronym UNESCO? Culture.
On which London thoroughfare is the Cenotaph situated? Whitehall.
What name is given in English to a figure of speech in which apparently contradictory terms appear in conjunction, eg deeply superficial? Oxymoron.
Who was British Prime Minister when the American Declaration of Independence was signed in 1776? Lord North.
Who was the Queen consort of King Charles the Second of England? Catherine of Braganza.
Which car marque produces the 'Insignia' model? Vauxhall.
"It was announced in 2010 that which American crime author was to write a new ""James Bond"" novel?" Jeffery Deaver.
Four US states border Lake Michigan - Michigan, Illinois and Wisconsin are three. Which is the fourth? Indiana.
In which Shakespeare play does most of the action place in the Forest of Arden? As You Like It.
Which common British garden bird has the Latin name cyanistes caeruleus or parus caeruleus'? Blue tit.
Which northern region of Italy is particularly associated with white truffles? Piedmont.
Of what is ergophobia the fear? Work.
For what does the R stand in the acronym UNHCR? Refugee.
How is the building 30 St. Mary Axe better known? The Gherkin.
According to Homer, who was Queen of Troy and mother of Paris and Hector? Hecuba.
In American football, how many points are awarded for a field goal? 3.
Which car marque produces the Tiguan model? Volkswagen.
The Suez Canal has its southern terminus at Port Tawfik, Suez. Where is its northern terminus? Port Said.
For what does the G stand in G. K. Chesterton? Gilbert.
According to Muslim tradition, who revealed the Qur'an to Mohammed? The angel Gabriel.
Specifically, on which island is the Franz Josef Glacier? South Island of New Zealand.
What type of bird is a maribou? A stork.
Cosette, Marius and Fantine are characters in which book and musical? Les Misérables.
What is the name of the dog in Enid Blyton's 'Famous Five' books? Timmy.
Name the son of Marcus Aurelius who succeeded him as Roman Emperor from 180-192 AD. Commodus.
